channel.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
channel.description:
Well, I am going to get one of them game systems in the title. I don't know which one to get though. If i am right, PS3 has free internet and stuff (i heard its laggy) and costs around $300, I heard Xbox 360's you pay for internet and its like $60. So its a $40 difference but Im not sure which is better.. Opinions please?
(Dont start flame wars saying one is better than the other, just state your opinion and dont judge others)
Thanks.

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Mr_x1 Mr...x..
item.description:
@Mr_x1 wrote:

For me I’ve always had a ps3. All my life I have went from ps1 - ps2 - ps3
But now…I play cod. ps3 controls SUCK for cod (my opinion)
aaannnnddd cod is my life…well no…but the only game I play…(other than rsps)
Oovverr all I would get the xbox.
Like u said its way cheaper.
Yes ps3 has internet, but who cares

I could go on more…but thats pointles…
Good bye .
(:

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

But that isn’t what he said. He said it had more features, he wasn’t claiming it was better in anyway - he named a feature it had over it.

Besides, the bullshit about the HDMI being better quality on the 360 is just that, bullshit. The Xbox 360 still operates internally on component (see: http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/digitalfoundry-vs-hdmi).

But even then, the differences are absolutely indistinguishable between the two. Also, PS3 HDMI is on revision 1.3a, the 360 HDMI is on 1.2.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

New.java:

Blue ray doesn’t necessarily mean better quality, but more so the ability to store more information on a single disk, rather then having to make multiple disks. Actually, In a review a year or so back by Gamestop, it showed that xbox with HDMI was better quality then the PS3 with HDMI & Blue-ray.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“New.java, post:36, topic:379723”]As for the $60 a year (it’s $55 :P), it won’t really break the budget. As for the storage, for $300, you get 250gb of storage, and an xbox slim. Usually, you get 1month to 1year of free live when you buy the console, too. As for the dimensions, xbox slim is smaller and lighter, compared to the PS3 slim.

Sorry if this seams one sided (I’m an xbox fan :|).[/quote]

My friend got the slim and it got a disc tray error within the first few months. Unlike the Elite Xbox, it couldn’t be fixed without sending it in (unless you took it apart as far as I know). Since he couldn’t find a guide and didn’t feel like voiding the warranty, he just sent it in. 250GB of storage seems to be what you pay for, which is practically useless unless you are downloading a ton of shit. The wireless is handy but who cares, my router is 3 feet from my Xbox.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Xbox might be better quality but I’ve experienced slower processing with games. It’s all about live though, I love playing Live over Xbox. The PS3, is free internet and faster processing, but the internet quality was not that good when I played.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @New.java New.java
item.description:
@New.java wrote:

laurent 248:

PS3 is blue ray and a better quality, +, you need to buy the Xbox live and it’s more than 60$/year. Buy a PS3, it’s less expensive. for 300$, Xbox gives only 4GB, for that price, PS3 give you 160GB.

Blue ray doesn’t necessarily mean better quality, but more so the ability to store more information on a single disk, rather then having to make multiple disks. Actually, In a review a year or so back by Gamestop, it showed that xbox with HDMI was better quality then the PS3 with HDMI & Blue-ray.

As for the $60 a year (it’s $55 :P), it won’t really break the budget. As for the storage, for $300, you get 250gb of storage, and an xbox slim. Usually, you get 1month to 1year of free live when you buy the console, too. As for the dimensions, xbox slim is smaller and lighter, compared to the PS3 slim.

Sorry if this seams one sided (I’m an xbox fan :|).

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:34, topic:379723”][quote author=laurent 248 link=topic=475565.msg3480633#msg3480633 date=1296084830]

PS3 games are this price because they are blue ray, it improves the game quality. That’s why.
[/quote]

That is not the reason at all. The costs of the discs are insignificant in to other costs that are piled on, the reason for the high price wherever he lives is probably due to some import taxes or something similar.[/quote]
True, every thing is overpriced over here, I wouldn’t be surprised if we had sweets priced 5 times the amount you’re charged.

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @laurent_248 laurent 248
item.description:
@laurent_248 wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9, post:24, topic:379723”]well PS3 also has inFamous and Uncharted and loads of other great games

You can’t compare between both of them, they’re just so similar, and don’t flame me, but I’ve always had an easier time with the controls on PS3 than on the Xbox. Too bad developing games on the PS3 is so hard, Xbox has at least 3X the games found on PS3. Just buy a 40 gb PS3 and an xbox 360 and you’re set for the rest of your life (at least until they make xbox 980 and ps4)

also…

PS3 is blue ray and a better quality, +, you need to buy the Xbox live and it’s more than 60$/year. Buy a PS3, it’s less expensive. for 300$, Xbox gives only 4GB, for that price, PS3 give you 160GB.

And when you have to buy expensive discs? I’ve always seen Xbox as the cheaper alternative. Also, The quality is very similar if not the same, so you can’t make such a comparison. I’ve also dced alot on PS3 but none on Xbox
so yeh
I got both anyways…

The games are the same price.

Well they’re not here… Converted to dollars, an Xbox game would be 10-20 max, while a PS3 game could reach 100 dollars.
Overpriced amirite[/quote]

PS3 games are this price because they are blue ray, it improves the game quality. That’s why.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Ix Soulcist xI, post:28, topic:379723”][quote author=B2300 T4nk link=topic=475565.msg3479276#msg3479276 date=1295975316]
PS3 pwns all. If you don’t wanna pay 15 dollars a year just to play on the XBL like me, just get a damn PS3.
[/quote]
In a sense that is the one reason I would switch to PS3. Other than that, there is not a sense to either have both or fight on which one to obtain. As stated above, the Xbox have a wider variety of games.

With a personal thought about the PS3, I found that the analog stick was difficult to handle, and function with. It might be one of those things we’rewhere I’m so use to the Xbox analog stick.[/quote]
[/grammar nazi]

But seriously, you find the Xbox analog easier to handle? Didn’t you own a PSX/PS2 before?
My dad was going to get an Xbox anyways, but he was able to find the PS3 at a low price so he figured he’d get both anyways, because both consoles really do have epic games that can’t be missed.

Read full topic

item.title: Xbox 360 - PS3
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

B2300 T4nk:

PS3 pwns all. If you don’t wanna pay 15 dollars a year just to play on the XBL like me, just get a damn PS3.

In a sense that is the one reason I would switch to PS3. Other than that, there is not a sense to either have both or fight on which one to obtain. As stated above, the Xbox have a wider variety of games.

With a personal thought about the PS3, I found that the analog stick was difficult to handle, and function with. It might be one of those things we’re I’m so use to the Xbox analog stick.

Read full topic
